name: php-sniffer
description: Uses PHP_CodeSniffer to format and lint PHP code.

phpSniffer.onTypeDelay.markdownDescription: When `phpSniffer.run` is `onType`, this sets the amount of milliseconds the validator will wait after typing has stopped before it will run.

phpSniffer.executablesFolder.markdownDescription: Use this to specify a different executable if it is not in your global `PATH`, such as when using `PHP_Codesniffer` as a project-scoped dependency. Include a trailing slash. Can be absolute or relative to the first folder in the workspace.

phpSniffer.standard.markdownDescription: The standards to check against. This is passed to the `phpcbf` and `phpcs` executables as the value for `--standard`. Can be absolute or relative to the first folder in the workspace.

phpSniffer.snippetExcludeSniffs.markdownDescription: Sniffs to exclude when formatting a code snippet (such as when _formatting on paste_ or on the command `format on selection`). This is passed to the `phpcbf` command as the value for `--exclude` when **not** formatting a whole file.

phpSniffer.windowsHardkill.markdownDescription: **Windows only.** Enables a tough `php` process killing for Windows machines. See the extension readme for why this may be required.

phpSniffer.windowsPhpCli.markdownDescription: **Windows only.** Requires `phpSniffer.windowsHardkill` to be `true`. The name of the `php` executable that `phpcs`/`phpcbf` runs with so that this extension can hard-kill it. See the extension readme for why this may be required.
